meanings.sent1: She was jabbing the straw into her drink.
meanings.sent2: He kept jabbing at the keyboard to fix the error.
meanings.sent3: The cat was jabbing playfully at the dangling string.
meanings.sent4: The rain was jabbing against the window like tiny needles.
meanings.sent5: The chef was jabbing the meat with a fork to check its tenderness.

meanings.definition: A quick, sharp blow or thrust
meanings.sent1: The boxer's jabbing caught his opponent off guard.
meanings.sent2: The jabbing of the needle made her wince.
meanings.sent3: The tree branches were jabbing at the window in the wind.
meanings.sent4: The jabbing of the pen on paper filled the room with sound.
meanings.sent5: The jabbing of the sword was swift and precise in the duel.
